comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Charles Sanger Mellen (August 16, 1852 – November 17, 1927) was an American railroad man whose career culminated in the presidencies of the Northern Pacific Railway (1897-1903) and the New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad (1903-1913)." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Sanger_Mellen See also New-York tribune., March 28, 1909, Image 15: HEADS OF GREAT RAILROADS WHO HAVE RISEN FROM HUMBLE BEGINNINGS He was a witness in the New Haven trial, see The Ogden standard., October 29, 1915, 4 P.M. CITY EDITION, Page 8: SENSATION AT NEW HAVEN TRIAL

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you for your great research B-59. We'll fill in the name in the record the next time we update.
